They do charge a $15 resort fee on top of that once you check in. Each day the supply bottled waters and pepsis (we live in atlanta... I have not drank a pepsi in years.. oh well) We also got a welcome bottle of wine. The wine was actually better than I thought it would be. My husband had called ahead, and they were more than nice to his requests for my birthday celebration. We had a wine tasting in the cave at the resort, which was a laid back, nice experience. Walked into the spa area, but did not do anything there as far as extra services. The concierge , Pam, totally hooked us up with wine tour ideas and discounts. She also gave us some restaurant suggestions. She wanted us to do the time share 90 minute deal, but we did not do that. There could have been more nice perks if we had sat there for 90 minutes, but our time was more precious. The only negative comment is that they need to focus on some of the little things, as an example, in the area by the restaurant, on a table out in the hallway, someone had written (only a kid would have gotten on the floor to do this) their name in the dust on the bottom area of the table. The top of the table had beautiful flowers on it.. but the bottom had some kids name. In our building there was duct tape in our elevator going up to the room. Yes, it matched the metal, and it did not really stand out, but whats with duct tape. We picked this hotel for the price, and location, as we wanted to focus our time and money on the wineries we visited. Pretty sure our UPS delivery man will think we made the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: gghope
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this one. It really is a nice place, I just expected more. Perhaps I would feel differently if we had booked and received an amazing deal, but we didn't. I think we paid around $200 a night, so by time taxes and the "resort" fee are added on it works out closer to $230, which for the Napa area, really is'nt bad, but when you hear about people getting $99/night, it's not great either. The hotel is oddly located in a small industrial park, about 10 min. outside of Napa, which is fine, because there is a shuttle that goes into town each night, 5pm to 1030 pm on a first come first serve basis. Just don't expect to be walking around town, and then to the hotel, also, it is close to a highway, not a noise issue, just odd, for a resort. The rooms are nice, ours did have a few issues, one of the decorations must have fallen off the wall, so there was just two larger holes on the wall where it should have been, the duvet cover was patched, poorly with an orange piece of material (the cover was a burgandy floral print...no orange) and the air conditioner ran the whole first night we were there and it was very loud. We did cal the repair man, and he "fixed" it by turning up the head so it would turn off. I know I'm sounding negative, but all in all it was nice. I had expected alot of Vino, and I was really looking forward to our stay there, maybe I had just built it up too much, but I would not stay there again. There is a small fitness room, nothing too fancy, but definately suffiecient, the pool and hot tub are both nice and the staff were all very friendly, and I'm happy to say that I we were not harassed by the time share staff.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it”
Reviews.Author: anon-12345678
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Vino Bello Resort and this one was huge disappointment. We booked a room with a king bed but on arrival were given two-bed one (they claimed some issues with booking system). Beds are tiny and very short (I'm 6'1"). Despite being a newly built property, buildings are extremely noisy - you can hear people walking on a floor above you and there was even some kind of metal clunking. In the morning (around 7am) cleaning stuff (they were cleaning another room) have woken us up - they were slamming doors, etc. I had to turn off the fridge at 5am as it started vibrating violently (something was loose inside). It's impossible to find parking around hotel if you arrived kinda late (~11pm). Wasn't able to make internet to work - wired was disconnected completely, wireless was hitting captive ATT portal that needed some password never mentioned anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “We were disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: hellomistersteve
Reviews.Content: We enjoy visiting California wine country once a year and normally stay in Yountville (a little further "up valley" as the locals say). Unfortunately, the hotels there were booked, so went online the night before and found vacancy at the Vino Bello Resort. Hotwire was running a deal. When we arrived, we were a little disappointed about the location. The resort is not close to any winery that you'd want to visit (in our opinion, of course). Further, because Vino Bello is a resort, they try to keep their guest on premises and charge a nominal ($15) resort fee -- which was not mentioned in the Hotwire promotion. Our biggest disappointment was the quality of the rooms. The rooms themselves are unusually shaped. They are fairly long rooms, but very narrow -- giving me a claustrophobic feeling. Further, the walls are paper thin. You can practically hear the conversations in the adjacent rooms. We stayed for two months, and one night, our neighbor was watching TV into the early morning. It was hard for us to fall asleep. I don't think we'd stay here again unless the other hotels were booked solid.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is "WOW"”
Reviews.Author: ilovemylittlepumkins
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful finish to our CA trip and what a perfect place to stay....Beautiful surroundings, 2 large hot tubs and a big heated pool kept our kids busy... The room was superb, clean, spacious, inviting.....(love the fireplace in the living area).. the bed was very comfortable...we slept like babies!!!! I can go on and on....We would definitely be back...Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and spacious”
Reviews.Author: comerdinger
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a private location. Scenic suroundings. Used the clean and nice Pool to soak up some sun. Rooms were spacious, clean and comfy. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean and modern!!! We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: CoupleofHoteliers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in the hotel industry. We loved everything about the Vino Bello Resort and would stay there again and recommend it to everyone. The service at the front desk was excellent! Our room was very large and modern. We had a comfortable king bed, large bathroom with oval tub/shower, washer and dryer and a kitchen/bar area. The room was extremely clean! We loved the pool, fire pits, and wine tasting areas too. We were disappointed with Siena (restaurant). The service and food wasn't good. Go somewhere else to eat. The rooms at the Vino Bello are larger and more modern than the adjoining Meritage hotel. Hotel is a little bit out of the way from the tourist spots, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: GetTheBestForLess
Reviews.Content: We saw a great rate through Travelzoo, and spent a few extra bucks for the 1 bedroom. Wow, is this a great place. We had an end unit on garden level, so our patio was quite private. The bathroom and shower are huge, kitchen has everything you need, complimentary wine and sodas/water are already in the fridge, there's a comfy bed and the place was QUIET... it was easy to make ourselves at home right away and get good sleep. We love Napa and Sonoma valley, but it was hard to leave the room to explore it! Only drawbacks we experienced: We were a bit dismayed by the kindof pushy sales pitch (for timeshare presentation) by the Concierge desk person when we asked an unrelated question, but after several 'no thank yous' from us, he relented and allowed us to be on our way back to this GREAT room. The only other thing we discovered was that there was a wine tasting/appetizer event going on right in the lobby at the time we checked in, but the front desk person never even mentioned it to us - - would have been an even nicer way to begin our stay, if we had known about it. We ended up reading about it in our room long after the fact. Aside from these fairly minor things, it is an awesome place to stay if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: lynnlynnTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in late October last year on a girl's (long) weekend. Room was very nice and well-maintained. Everything was very clean. It had a big bathroom with plenty of room. We had the room w/ a full kitchen, dining area, living room. There is a restaurant there, but we didn't use it. We did eat at the bar one evening, and the food was good if a bit overpriced (but that's to be expected when dining at a hotel, so it wasn't really a surprise). The building we stayed in had a fitness center, but it was rather bare bones (we did notice the fitness center in another building looked a lot nicer than the one in our building...don't recall the name of the building we were in). It is conveniently located to a Target and grocery store, which was great since we had the full kitchen. We also found it a convenient location to visit both Napa and Sonoma wineries (~20 - 30 minute drive, depending on where we were headed)....granted, not as convenient as staying right in Yountville or Sonoma maybe, but also generally not as expensive. Reasons I gave it 4 instead of 5: the room had a hairdryer that was literally spitting sparks and we had to call 2 or 3 times before they finally replaced it. Also, we did not consistently get our towels replaced (for example, 1 day we were only given 4 clean towels, no washcloths or hand towels...the next day we got hand towels, still not washcloths even though we'd called and asked for some). Also, the room does come w/ a mini clothes washer and dryer, which is nice, but the despite following the instructions on how to run them, they took quite a bit of fiddling with to get them to run, and they were very loud (sounded like a jet engine taking off). And, as I mentioned before, the fitness center in our building was only barely adequate (not sure if we could've used the nicer one in the other building or not) All in all though, it was a very nice, quite place to stay while in the area and I would recommend it overall.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: pgrast
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of a special promotion the resort was offering. We really enjoyed the complimentary bottle of wine left in the lovely room. Staff was exceptionally nice and informative, and dinner at the restaurant was one of the best we had in Napa Valley. I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Resort in Napa”
Reviews.Author: pacpal13
Reviews.Content: Not on the main drag in Napa, but conveniently located to visit Napa or Sonoma. The outside appearance is that of a nice aparment or condo complex. But this inside of the units are appointed very nicely. The feel is luxurious and 4-star. Service was great, the resort is clean and maintained, and for the prices we paid, a great bang for the buck. Not sure if this will become a time-share resort or remain a regular hotel. Once the public becomes aware of this place, not sure I would return when the rates go up to $300/night plus. But at $200/night and under, can't wait to return! Napa is growing, and conveniently located near new shopping center with grocery store, fast food, etc. Grade = A.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: leonoids
Reviews.Content: The Vino Bello was truly an awesome place to stay. The suite included a spacious kitchen, living room bedroom and incredible bathroom/shower! I definitely recommend going to the Wine Cave for a wine tasting. Also, be sure to get a massage in the spa which is also located in the Cave.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: TheDeltaDuo
Reviews.Content: We found Vino Bello through an internet search looking for somewhere to stay for a spur of the moment weekend getaway. The rate for the one room condo was so good that we were concerned what we might find when we arrived. We knew as soon as we pulled up we had made the right decision. What an awesome place. The grounds are beautiful. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The condo was the best surprise of all. The fireplace and jacuzzi were just what we needed since it was cold and raining most of the weekend. Loved having the bottle of wine, sodas, water and a bag of popcorn with the DVD we checked out at the front desk. We have already made reservations to return next month.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: Faulekatze
Reviews.Content: Our friends had previously stayed at this resort and highly recommended this place, so we decided to book our rooms here. We were very happy with our one bedroom condo. Everything is clean and even the top of the refrigerator was dustless! They pretty much got everything we needed for our stay there, from kitchen ware to laundry. We would definitely come back for our next Napa trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: gwj56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vino Bello but was able to use the amenities at the Meritage, so we got a very good deal on our room. I just loved the fact that a bottle of wine/water/soda came with the room. Just had a great weekend even though it was to cold to use their outdoor pool and jacuzzi. The studio room was nicely decorated, clean, and the kitchenette was very well set up. Will definitely go back again. The only drawback is that it is outside of Napa, but only 10-15 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “our best trip ever”
Reviews.Author: Leland23
Reviews.Content: we travel alot and have seen some "black holes" but we hit a grand slam with Priceline when we chose a 4 star hotel and arrived at Vino Bella. hidden under a hill of grape vines and behind a commercial park is a wonderful resort with all the "plush" things that make the stay memorable. the staff was always eager to please and so friendly and at every turn there to help or guide you somewhere. the signage needs some improvement but we would come back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room...and went home with clean laundry!”
Reviews.Author: relocator678
Reviews.Content: We came to the valley to house hunt and were very excited to run across the Vino Bello on line. It was amazingly refreshing after a long day of running around to be able to not only cook dinner in our room and watch free movies, eat popcorn in a living room that felt like home but we could even throw in a load of laundry, which anyone traveling with kids knows this is a godsend! It was quiet from other rooms and even road noise and our room backed the pool so the kids could play in the pool while we watch in sweatshirts. The staff were very helpful and even were able to accommodate everyone different taste by let the kids each pick out their own DVD (a slight break in the rule from one per room) which made everyone happy. I would recommend the 1-2 bedroom suites the couple extra bucks were worth everyone getting some privacy. My only compliant was the fireplace didn't work...that would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave anything behind - you won't get it back”
Reviews.Author: SerafinaEugene
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend booking though hotels.com for $99/night. The hotel was a bit difficult to find, and it was confusing to have to check in at a separate building with a different name, especially at night when signs were not well lit. The room was very clean and well equipped. We only needed a place to sleep so the washer/dryer and kitchenette were extra perks. We had a lot of trouble getting the internet to work, and hotel staff didn't seem to know that their service provider had changed. (When accessing the wifi to which they directed us a screen appeared saying it had been taken over by AT&T). After having someone sent to our room to help we had to settle for a dial-up speed ethernet connection. We made use of the heated pool and jacuzzi outside, which was great, but we were glad we brought towels from the room because there were none out there despite signage stating that there would be. We left quickly in the morning to head to a vineyard in Sonoma before driving back to the SFO airport, and I left a $150 freshly dry-cleaned wool coat in the closet. I realized this at the airport at 5 pm and called the hotel. I was directed to the lost and found where I could only leave a message. I didn't get a call back so I tried again later that evening. After finally contacting a live person I explained my problem and was told I would get a call back. When they called back I was told that there was nothing found in the room. The man I spoke to acted like I was accusing him personally of stealing it and was very defensive. He seemed eager to get rid of me and tried to make me feel stupid for expecting to talk to anyone about this on a Saturday evening. Aren't weekends the busiest time for hotels? I tried calling again the following Monday when I could speak to the Executive Housekeeper. He said he would try to check the room again and get back to me. He never called. I think somebody there has a new coat.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: fcah0218
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I loved Vino Bello! We stayed here for our sight-seeing tour of Napa and Sonoma, and it was ideally located for both. The hotel cost us $99/night off of Expedia, and it was a steal. Our room was gorgeous. It had a view overlooking the Meritage, a complimentary bottle of wine (it was a really great bottle of rose), complimentary water and soft drinks, a huge bed, and a huge soaking tub. Room service was reasonably priced, and because it always came quickly or at the time requested, we ordered quite frequently. They always did things that were considerate - For example, if you ordered one orange juice, they would bring two just in case. If the room had cost us $250/night, we still would have felt like we had a great deal. The concierge was very friendly and so were the folks at the front desk, wine tasting room, and spa. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding Stay”
Reviews.Author: jbecerra
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at Vino Bello/Meritage. I recently got married on the 19th of December and I decided to book a room there the day before the wedding (stay with my bridesmaids) and the night of the wedding. It was beautiful. We had a nice pool side and vineyard view. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The condo that we stayed in was huge for the price that you pay for and it has a double sink bathroom with five showerheads...yup five! It had a nice jacuzzi in the room and a fireplace in the living room. With the fireplace alone there was no need to turn on the heater. The kitchen was such a nice accomadation and it was supplied with everything that we needed for that weekend. Additionally, the staff was very nice and met our every need. When we called to ask for extra blankets they were there within 10 min. We also asked for the room to be cleaned at a specific hour and they came at that time to clean the room. I must add that we walked into the room and to our delight there was a nice bottle of wine wating for us. :) It was a relaxing stay, and even through I'm from Napa, I would stay there again just for the heck of it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SC680
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Vino Bello and was very impressed by the quality of the hotel for the great rate we received. I would definitely visit again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: DMinDeacon
Reviews.Content: The room was just right for a visit spent all day at wineries in the Napa and Sonoma area. It was great to be able to fix a snack or warm up a meal and drink a bottle just purchased on a day's outing. The staff was incredibly welcoming and warm. The breakfast in the restaurant was very reasonable, and the portions were significant. We will not blink twice about staying again when we come back to Wine Country in August 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service, great price”
Reviews.Author: Luv4wine50
Reviews.Content: Large spacious room loaded with aminities. The service was outstanding throughout the resort. The restaurant provided excellent food at a fair price. We stayed Sunday through Wednesday before thanksgiving and got a rate of 99 a night. I have paid over 300 a night for resorts not as nice as this one. Stay in the timeshare section for more room.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, pleasurable stay”
Reviews.Author: Deez526
Reviews.Content: Vino Bello is a great resort and a great value for the money. Other resorts are significantly more expensive and don't give you all of the luxuries you will find at the Vino Bello. The staff and the rooms are nice and very comfortable. The only problem we did have was that our room was located right next door to the maid's storage closet so we did hear the door quite often in the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, not so great noise”
Reviews.Author: Artsyamanda
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I arrived at Vino Bello Resort for our honeymoon. Upon arriving, they gave us our room, which was beautiful, and we settled in. That night, we could barely sleep because we realized that they had put us on the first floor right next to the loading dock for their delivery trucks. So, all through the night all we heard were trucks driving up to our window and stopping and making SOO much noise. It was really hard to sleep. The next day we went to the front desk to ask them about some extra charges we noticed on our card and the man asked if we were on our honeymoon. We said yes and he asked if the front desk had told us the night before about the honeymoon amenities that we get. We said no and he said he would take care of it. Well, we stayed there for 2 more days and didn't hear anything from anyone. I will say the rooms are just beautiful and very clean. It was just unfortunate that they selected such a location for us knowing we were on our honeymoon, and then told us they would take care of us in regards to amenities and didn't do anything.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: barbs4545
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Vino Bello once before and also at the Meritage Hotel which is connected. When I checked in a specically asked for a very quiet room. I had requested it also when I made the reservation. But just to be on the safe side I asked again when I checked in that it be very quiet. The girl at the desk said yes it was a very quiet room. Well when I returned from dinner around 8 p.m. to my room........the next room to me had the T.V. on so loud it was unbelieveable. So I thought well it is early and they will turn it down soon. It went on like that until 1 a.m. in the morning. The hotel was not booked at all. It was a Wed. night. So why they put me in a room next to a family with kids...........I can't understand it. Finally at 2 a.m. I went to sleep. The next night the T.V. was also on but went off around midnight. I was disappointed....because I specially asked for a quiet room. Both when I made the reservation and when I got to the hotel. The look that the girl gave her friend at the desk when I checked in made me think that she knew I would be next to a noisy family. The times I have spent at the hotel before this was very quiet. I didn't complain.....because the second night the hotel was getting full and I knew they most likely would not move me to another location. I don't know if it is because this is a timeshare or what. But they should be conscious of treating their guests with more respect. I may stay there again..........but this time I would talk to a manager and not one of the young girls who check you in at the desk. They need to have a talk with their employees at the desk about treating customers with more respect. Other than that the bellhop, the cleaning people were wonderful. Also I know from before that the manager is great. Because I left my camera and he sent it to me........even though I paid the charges to be sent. I still appreciated getting my camera back. I will give this hotel another try........it is beautiful, clean and modern. Just make sure you are not next to a noisy family.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: aktrav3
Reviews.Content: In the interest of full disclosure, I will say that we booked this room through Priceline (won't do that again), and we were visiting Napa to celebrate our 15th anniversary. First - this is a timeshare - not a traditional hotel. "Full kitchen" in the one-room "suite" consists of a counter running half the length of the wall, with a small microwave, toaster oven, and dorm-room sized refrigerator. Not what we had expected. But, really, that's all they can fit into this very small room. They had messed up our reservation by not noting that we requested a room with a king-size bed. So, we ended up with two full-size beds - and the staff were absolutely unhelpful and made promises to move us the next day, but never followed through on their promises. The room is so cramped with two beds that there was no place to sit. How would a timeshare owner possibly stay there for a week? I have no idea where they would sit to read the newspaper or eat a meal. The washing machine in our room dripped very loudly and woke us - and kept us up - for several hours in the middle of the night. The location is quite a drive from most of the wineries - it takes about 10-15 minutes to get to the concentrated winery area. That was an additional drawback. Finally, the rate we paid through Priceline was not a deal - anyone could've gotten the same rate by booking at the Vino Bello site and pre-paying. And then they would've been treated a lot better by the staff. They pretty much dismissed us - having booked through Priceline. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property at great value”
Reviews.Author: tripsterSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Vino Bello on a recent overnight trip to Napa. I chose this hotel because I had friends staying at its sister hotel, Meritage, located on the same property as Vino Bello. Vino Bello was significantly less expensive. I paid $99/night for a room with a kitchenette and washer/dryer (in room!). The rooms were furnished in the luxury meets comfort style de jour (i.e. granite counters tops, big garden tub, big wood furniture, nice appliances etc). We received a complimentary bottle of wine plus two complimentary bottles of water in the room, the latter of which is necessary after consuming the former. There was no parking fee and ample parking. There is a $15. resort fee, which gives you access to the Meritage pool etc. I only stayed one night, but am guessing the $15 fee is a nightly one. Include this in your budget. In my limited stay, I made it to the Hess winery and the in-house wine tasting room. This hotel is not in the heart of the Napa town square. So if that is the experience you want, this is not your hotel. If you are going to do a day of wine tastings from Vino Bello, you might want to hire a tour company that drives you from winery to winery. I am sure the concierge could provide assistance. Overall, I was very pleased with my stay here and will stay again on my next trip to Napa. At $100/night, I can afford to buy more wine from my tastings!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent!”
Reviews.Author: MRSC_9
Reviews.Content: This the 2nd time I stay at Vino Bello and it seems this won't be the last!! We had a great time again. The staff, the restaurant, the pool... Everything was perfect. I booked online and had almost no problems... One day there was no hot shower but they solve it in a couple of hours. Thanks for another excelent holliday!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Pharmacy11
Reviews.Content: We had never been to California and decided to go here on our honeymoon. We traveled from LA to Yosemite to Napa. The room here was SOOOO relaxing. It is dead set in the middle of town (which we were expecting it to be more of a off set location) but it wasn't noisy from being in town. Our room had a washer/ dryer so I was able to get all of our laundry done up before flying back home, which was a huge plus. The room had a conventional oven, refrigerator, fully stocked with dishes- Therefore we were able to make ourselves a late breakfast (bagel with cream cheese and a banana which held us over till dinner) and save lots on eating out! The hotel provided us with a complimentary bottle of wine and 2 sodas in the room, already chilled waiting on us... Not to be mean, but the wine was terrible BUT everyone has different taste buds and we aren't a HUGE red wine fan anyway! They supplied us with one load of laundry detergent for each day so that was very nice as well. We were on the go so much, we didn't get to enjoy the pool but it looked very nice. Each room has a balcony with table and chairs on it so that was VERY NICE to use since I smoke (instead of having to walk through the hotel, go down the elevators, and stand outside around others in my PJ's first thing in the morning! haha)! The beds were amazingly comfortable.... We got free high speed internet in our room which was very nice! Overall if we ever go back to Napa, This is defiitely where we will be staying again. I can't say much about the staff because the main office isn't located where the rooms are. So the only time we dealt with anyone was during check in and out... We got there at 2am to check in and my husband checked us out... The gentleman there during check in was pleasant. Our experience was excellent at this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy "shell" but lovely accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: JLatzMD
Reviews.Content: The Vino Bello hotel is a condo/timeshare facility, next to The Meritage Resort (where you check in). Everything is new and the staff are friendly. We were in the "Chardonnay" building, second of the three floors. The security, building grounds, pool area and common areas within the buildings were beautifully done and very clean. Our room was eloquently furnished - tile floors, granite countertops, beautiful woodwork, a mini-kitchen, nice flat screen t.v - furnished with a toaster oven, microwave, coffee maker and dishes, etc.. The bath towels were luxurious and absorbent. The only negatives were the "shell" or structure of the building - the walls were very thin, we could hear the insomniac on the third floor pacing all night, as well as his/her t.v., and the balcony seemed to "give" when I walked out on it (admittedly 6' tall and 280 lbs). Location is at the bottom of the "V" that heads, NW, to Sonoma and, NE to Napa - good launching base though, if you're really wanting to explore both, you might look at something midway, halfway up the valleys, e.g. Yountville. Overall a nice accomodation, eloquently appointed. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place”
Reviews.Author: callieSF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our adult daughter to Napa for wine tasting- after a lot of searching we found the Vino Bello. It turned out that the hotel website had the best price, and didn't charge for an extra person so we booked it. It was a fabulous 1 bedroom suite with an in room jacuzzi, full kitchen, king bed plus queen pullout, fireplace, and large balcony. The bathroom was huge with a great shower. It was very comfortable and quiet. There were a couple of swimming pools and hot tubs - we chose the one by our room. There were large towels available right next to the hot tub. All the hotel personnel were very accommodating. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed- For a second time.”
Reviews.Author: dklSFlove
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say the property is beautiful. The rooms are well appointed, but the service lacks. We arrived late on a busy friday night to a not so pleasant front desk agent who was not shy in showing it. We were assigned the WORST studio suite possible. Our view was over the timeshare office. I had called ahead to let them know we were arriving late, so that, if possible they would assign us into a better room, as this was the second time we had stayed in that room. Such a dissapointment. As for the service between day and night - was exactly that - polar opposites. Since we had arrived late we had not eaten so went to call in to order room service (from the room service 'all night' menu) to find they no longer serve over night. Hmmm...Then take that out of the room maybe??? Just a thought... Then, we went to use the fridge and once we opened it, the freezer door fell off. We called it in, but was not offered to fix it. We also only had one robe in the room, and things missing in the mini bar... Just strange. I understand it is tough economic times, but when it is most important to leave a good impression, I would think it would be now, especially when people have paid thousands and thousands of dollars for this timesare - SUCH A WASTE. I do sound like I am venting a little much, but I myself work in the hotel industry, so I appreciate quality. Even decent quality.)

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay At Vino Bello Next Time”
Reviews.Author: rnc99
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline, that was my first mistake. Pd $175/night & found a promotion online for the same room for $129/night, Priceline refused to match & of course, I could not change the reservation...so a little unhappy to begin with, but we thought, ok, no problem. The room was well appointed & located, in the Chardonnay bldg, 2nd floor overlooking the pool area, 2 double beds & front desk would not change us to a king without an upcharge which was disappointing. Nice fridge, MW, robes & bathroom, but water dripped continuously from the a/c & the foyer entrance into the rooms made opening & closing the doors very LOUD for all the neighbors. We ate dinner at Sienna on the property, which was fine, except our food required about a 1 hr. wait & there were only about 3 tables occupied at the time. Our waitress adjusted our bill & explained the mistake when she finally served the food, so while it was addressed, it made for a less than stellar dining experience. The wine cave was closed when we attempted to go for the "free" tasting. We didn't really appreciate the $15 resort fee/night tagged onto our bill at the end either. We would not choose this place in the future as there are too many quaint & better located places to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel with great Spa”
Reviews.Author: sdbyrd
Reviews.Content: My wife took me on a trip to San Francisco/Napa for my 30th birthday and we stayed at Vino Bello in Napa. We were both happy with the entire resort during our 2 night stay. The room was spacious and had a large bathroom. I'm not sure if all of the rooms are much different from each other, but ours had a mini-fridge, microwave and a flat-panel TV. We received a free bottle of wine in our fridge upon our arrival. There was also a large pool, small kiddie pool and an average size hot tub. Two gas grills were also setup at the pool area to use freely. We bought some steaks and had our own cookout one night and it was a lot of fun! Although it's a 5 minute drive into downtown Napa, the resort offered a free shuttle service that ran every half hour. This was very convenient since we didn't want to drink & drive. We also had massages in the Spa's 22,000 sq/ft Cave! I really don't have any negative things to say about Vino Bello and would highly recommend to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well-appointed resort”
Reviews.Author: MFoucs
Reviews.Content: Took wife on a two-day visit to Napa and stayed at Vino Bello. Overall, had wonderful experience. Easy check-in and excellent service. We enjoyed the suite, appreciated the complimentary wine bottle, and loved the pool area. We found it to be more of a family-oriented than couples place, but that didn't bother us. The Meritage (part of Vino Bello--you actually check in at the Meritage) seemed to have more conference-type events going on. We went for a short walk in the vineyard, lounged by the pool, and checked out a DVD from their complimentary movie library, along with a bag of popcorn. Only complaint was the location: a bit out of the way and in more of a business area south of the town of Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place (4 Stars) but Reservation Snafu (Poor)”
Reviews.Author: bubbly57
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times with friends but this was the first time I booked the reservation. I enjoyed my stay but the service this time was far from perfect and a five star resort. I booked online and immediately called the hotel to ensure that I received a room a high floor and the two bedroom condo unit I reservered had the two beds in the second bedroom. I was told to call the 866 number listed on the website which I did, have the gentleman my information and said it would be noted in the reservation. When we got there at 9:30 and the room was not ready (not an issue we were early) but we could "early check in", told the young woman my room info and said not a probem, you are here early! We went out for the day and got back at approx 4:30 and went to our room "assuming" we had the room I called in advance for and double-checked at check in. Well it was not, we had one bed and a pull out and no other rooms unavailable to until the next evening. After much going back and forth and being told by the manager that the 866 I called, she had no idea what it was or who I called (posted on the website), she finally agreed to adjust the room rate (she took off one of the rooms fee, thank you, we were pleased). She agreed to move us to next day to the room I had requested. Day two arrives, I call the front desk and speak with a gentleman, I explain what had happened, he said they will move while we are out for the day. Trying to be nice and accomodating to the staff at the site, we moved all of our luggage into one room and let the front desk know. I explained that we will need to have a room as we had spa treatments for that afternoon and needed to be in our new rooms by 3:00 at the latest. Said it should not be problem. We got to the site at 3:00, waited in line for about 15 minutes because others were having issues with their reservations. Long story short, two rooms that we paid for were now given away, we had no rooms. The room with a luggage had the door open when we arrived, it was already cleaned and people were already checked in! Our rooms that we were being mvoed to were still not ready. So we paid, thank goodness for only one room thanks for the comp"d room the night before but paid for a room a full day that we were checked out of. We were moved to a room with the two beds but it was over, I guess the trash and fixit station. I guess we got paid back for our "free" one room. To top it off, they were paving the parking lot and they stagged their equipment on our little parking area at 7:00 in the morning. No notice of construction when you checked in, found out about it with a note tapped to the entry door to building. Had to park on street as there was not enough parking to accomodate their guests. Although the place is nice, the managment team needs to help assist their customers in the problems that the site encounters and brings on themselves.

Reviews.Title: “I would come back”
Reviews.Author: gobeav494
Reviews.Content: While some of the other comments bear some merit, we had a noise problem as well, but the staff took care of the problem immediately. Part of the property is a time share, but I could not have cared less. I really liked the fact that there was an adults only pool as well as a family pool. We have a large family, but we were getting away! I really don't want to worry whether or not the swim diaper works while I am in the sauna while on vacation. The staff were excellent, the food in the bar was rather tasty. I would go back, however, I must admit that I got a screaming deal on Expedia. I might shop for future trips if I did not get such a deal later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: curlyqlinks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights with our nephew and his wife in a one bedroom condo on the ground floor. We wine tasted the first day with the help of the concierge and returned to cook dinner in our kitchen. The next day we attended the races in Sonoma and returned to our "home" to cook another meal. We loved the feeling of our condo. Everything was first class. The only issue was upstairs neighbors noise all night and a shower of objects being hurled from the top floor while we were lounging on our patio. One call to the front desk took care of it. We plan to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Who was the contractor on this project?”
Reviews.Author: bigedHappyValley_OR
Reviews.Content: Certainly a beautiful place but: --Long line at check-in with only one clerk --Room temperature was 51 degrees --Not sure who built the timeshare units but the first night I felt that I was in a room with a toddler banging pans until midnight. Very poor construction. Staff was helpful and did change my room.

Reviews.Title: “Get a third floor room!! Ceilings not insulated at all -- or maybe there were monkeys upstairs!”
Reviews.Author: europeadvise
Reviews.Content: This is the first timeshare that I have ever checked into where no resort activities sheet was given out. Normally, resorts will have activities for adults and kids. No information received. On the positive, no sales pitch either. We entered our room to find a cart loaded with paint supplies, etc. I called the front desk and they said they would retrieve the cart. When the maintenance guy came, he advised us that the air was not working properly and would not cool off under 75 degrees. Well, that is cool enough for us, but he neglected to tell us that the air would defrost and water would drip in the entry and the shower unless the air ran continuously. So, we had a cold waterfall coming out of the ceiling on us in the shower. The pull-out was stained with who knows what -- it took some convincing for my daughters to sleep on it -- ugh! Then at about midnight, monkeys moved in upstairs. So, by the morning we requested a new room, unfortunately it took the better part of the day to get the move done. Once we relocated the stay was better, but it took up half of our two-day stay. Ironically, they were concerned about getting the maids in to clean our old room -- why would the have any new guest move in without fixing the air??? The rooms are really beautiful and I would bet a stay on the top floor would be absolutely a pleasure, but the lower floors are not the best. So, beware!

Reviews.Title: “Vino Bella...Molto Buono!”
Reviews.Author: AbitaGuy
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Vino Bella and we really enjoyed our exprience. Rosemary, the concierge was wonderful. Cynthia at the restaurant was so very kind and helpful. In fact, from our waitress to the bar tender, all of the staff were friendly and most helpful. Should our travels take us back to Napa, we most certainly will stay at Vino Bella!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Stay in Beautiful Napa!”
Reviews.Author: njstraveler
Reviews.Content: This resort was wonderful from the time we arrived until we checked out. The staff and concierge were great and the room was perfect for us! When we turned into the industrial park area, we weren't sure what we would find. But the grounds and interior of the resort were beautiful! Upon check in the gentleman at the front desk made us reservations at a great restaurant downtown. The shuttle service was great too. The concierge booked us on a Wine Tasting tour with Platypus...which I highly recommend! Overall the resort was wonderful! I would recommend it to others and definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No Mistake it is a time share but a darn good one”
Reviews.Author: SpenceHouston
Reviews.Content: Down falls >> Its in a buisness park. so the front of the site is not so great. but please don't get me wrong you can live with the front not so nice for the price of the stay. Ups>> 1. Room was nice....no very nice. We had our own kitchen, laundry, dineing room, livingroom, even a JACUZZI in the bedroom. Bathroom was huge. 2. The backside of the grounds are great nice pool area as well. You can also go next door and use the pool and Spa. 3. The staff was great. 4. NO sales pitch. They asked us once, yes only once, if we would like to see what they offer. We said no and that was it. NO sales pitch!!!!! 5. Great food in the dining area a little pricey but very good wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star resort. More of a timeshare.”
Reviews.Author: laurjohn
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort through Priceline (only saved $10!) and it was listed as a 4 star resort. Not true! It is really a timeshare resort. It is located in an office park and is adjacent to another resort which seems much nicer. The rooms are nice and clean and have a small kitchen counter with a sink, fridge, microwave and toaster oven. We stayed in a studio. I thought it was very expensive for what we got. Over $200 a night for a hotel that was not as nice as many I have stayed in. We were on the second floor of a 3 story building and could hear people upstairs walking around until all hours of the night. Also, the air conditioning was not working well the second night of our stay. At one point I tried to call both the concierge and front desk and the phone just rang and rang with no answer. Finally got an operator. Parking was a problem at night. Had to park very far away from our building. Also, there is construction underway that we were not aware of beforehand. It was not going on over the weekend. There is a nice pool area for families with a kiddie pool and water feature area for them. Our toddler enjoyed that a lot. We arrived around 3:00 the first day and was told by the concierge that there was a restaurant in the hotel, but we found it to be closed until 5:30. Had to eat in the bar with our toddler. Food was good though. The concierge for the Vino Bello was there on Saturday when we checked in but informed us she was leaving for the rest of the weekend and we could use the one in the adjoining resort. Seemed strange as it was a busy weekend there. Overall, it was not what I expected and I was disappointed for the amount of money we paid to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a nice place....”
Reviews.Author: linds_g
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom just for the night for a Napa girls trip. Like the other reviews said, the Vino is located in a weird place, but the grounds are very beautiful. The free shuttle to downtown Napa is a huge plus, so you don't have to worry about driving after enjoying some local wine! The driver, Tony, was awesome, and gave us great restaurant tips (Allegria, most def check it out). The room was really nice, with a little patio, and check in/out was easy. Even though it's a time share property, the staff did not push us to sit through a boring presentation AT ALL, which was nice. The "complimentary wine" is a rose, so keep that in mind if that's not your deal. We brought a bottle of chardonnay and some cheese and crackers, and enjoyed our lovely patio. My only big complaint was the RIDICULOUSLY loud air conditioner. It kicked on every fifteen minutes or so, and seriously sounded like a plane was taking off or something. Like, my mom and I had to literally raise our voices to hear each other! But, overall, this was a beautiful place. We got a deal on expedia....I would DEFINITELY not pay three hundred bucks to stay here, but then again I probably wouldn't pay that much to stay anywhere. If yiou can get a decent deal, check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Extraordinaire”
Reviews.Author: AlpineCowgirl
Reviews.Content: We just stayed 5/18-22 at Vino Bello Resort! LOVED IT! Beautiful place, HUGE 1 bedroom suite, lovely decorated, quite location, a bit out of the way, but we were so tucked in and comfortable we hardly noticed, except to drive in and out to wineries and dinner. Easy to get in and out of. Lots of ammenities. Housekeeping was spotless and we appreciated the extras. Had room service, it was fine too. Lots of paths to wander up the hill. Beatiful landscaping. We had hoped to trade our week through RCI, but that did not come through, so we paid a pretty high rate, because we thought from the website it was worth it. IT WAS GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Napa Hidden Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: sabi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 day 20th Anniversary Get-Away. This resort located in a industrial area sits on the same grounds as the Mertiage Hotel. We had a one bedroom studio which was just perfect for the price ( didn't have the points to book through RCI) and the two of us. The location of the resort is perfect, just off the highway and 4 to 5 miles from downtown Napa. You have to visit the downtown area - Allegria - Restaurant was the best. I mean the very best. The food and service was top notch - went there on our first day of arrival - 20th and then we had to celebration our departure with a great meal. Some of the other gotta try restaurants (sorry can't think of the names of them but you have to go and eat there) are right in that little square near the vistors information center, another one that stands out is Piccolini ( good - decent). Also go by the um... riverfront right off of First street near the courthouse and Napa Inn B&B a few other good eats and a delicious sweet shop. Don't go to Buttercreme Bakery! It was a waste of our time and money. Not one of our personal favs - have and MUCH MUCH better and the staff wasn't very friendly. Back to the resort for a minute: The staff at the Mertiage is great - people friendly and the bar area is perfect with great evening entertainment. I am not a wine drinker but my husband drinks socially. We visited some very nice wineries - the most memorable being in St. Helena just about a 30 minute ride from the resort. Our two favorites were The White Hall and Prager ( actually met the owners). They are just off the main highway down the road from each other. Prager was very interesting because the tasting and wineries are in the backyard or basment of the owners summer home? Busy they are but very accommodating. Heading back to the resort is a restaurant called The Mustard. Fine to California Casual dining. nice prices and the food looked very good but the wait was 25 minutes and we had, had too much to sip so we needed food ASAP (LOL). I mean a day full of sipping can take its toll. Anyway, back at the resort there is a sufficient fitness center to meet your cardo needs and the pool and jaguzzi was great. This resort doesn't have a restaurant on site so you share with the Mertiage which is maybe 20 steps away. The food was always excellent. I hope this write up helps and if you have any further questions please ask. Oh.... evenings require a lite sweater or jacket. PS: the only minus is in the AM when housekeeping and I guess other visitors are moving around you can hear them. But for some reason today - Sunday- it wasn't so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay very much!”
Reviews.Author: mpbros22
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and comfortable...all the comforts of home. The grounds were beautiful and well kept. Our room had a nice balcony which I would recommend, however...be careful....we got locked out on our patio due to a finicky door lock and had to holler to other guests to call staff to let us in!!! We took it in good humor, but just a word of caution if you go on the patio late at night! The staff was very friendly and helpful. In particular, the concierge gave great advice on recommending where to dine ( and they will be happy to make reservations for you) and which places to visit. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle which takes you to downtown Napa in the evening between 5:30 and 10:30 ( about a 7 min drive)....a great ammenity if you feel like enjoying some wine over dinner instead of being the designated driver!!!! The location isn't directly in the heart of the valley , but it is only a short drive (about 8 minutes) to the beginning of the valley where all the wineries along highway 29 begin. Also, this is a hotel, but it also a time share type property. However, not once did we feel any pressure to buy them! We were only informed one time in an off-hand and casual manner that we were welcome to attend a session to learn more about those opportunities. We graciously declined and that was the end of it!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: jandres12
Reviews.Content: This place was great for the price we paid ($95/night on priceline + a resort fee). It's a newer place, and had a nice walking trail througha vineyard where you can reach the "grape crusher" you can see from the highway. It is in a great location to visit both Napa and Sonoma. They were very friendly in the wine tasting cave, although it's not the greatest wine. Did not use the spa, but the concierge was very helpful when you could fine him.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Napa”
Reviews.Author: framtid
Reviews.Content: Overall a great place to start your Napa visit. Although they initially fumbled the reservation, they quickly fixed the situation and upgraded me. The place was immaculate and I'm planning to send my parents to this hotel when they visit this Summer. My few issues were: 1) the wine they give you as part of the "hotel fee" was swill; 2) very little sound proofing (get a place a high floor); 3) stay away from the entrance doors (you will here everyone come in); 4) This option didn't come up on my initial search of Hotels.com...I found it some other round about way (yet it was still sold out during my stay). Just some thoughts from a very frequent traveller.

Reviews.Title: “You've Got to Be Kidding!”
Reviews.Author: PQBrown
Reviews.Content: The "resort" is in a corporate park. No kidding! From the balcony we could watch people going to work at the numerous plants and offices situated there. And after a day in the area, we met some of these folks as they left work. Weird. The resort itself is a bit like an apartment building underserved by a single elevator. The cleaning staff blocked the narrow hallways throughout the day. The balcony was tiny. We were just happy that we insisted on a room WITH a balcony rather than the main floor room (and the tiny, very public concrete "pad") they wanted to put us in. The one positive aspect: we chose NOT to sit through the presentation enticing visitors to buy into the vacation club.

Reviews.Title: “High maintenance customer couldn't have been happier”
Reviews.Author: Tellmehowtosayit
Reviews.Content: I threw a wedding shower in a room at this hotel two years ago. The location was right for the bride- she lives nearby in Napa. So, when it came time to throw her baby shower, it seemed right to pick the same place. Honestly, the first time around, I was sort of disappointed with the customer service I received on the phone-they couldn't find the reservation, they were argumentative. When I got there, it was beautiful and people were nice, but the experience was a little soured because of the phone service. The hotel was still very new at that point and they were working out kinks. This time around, there was not one shortcoming. The rooms are BEAUTIFUL! The kitchen has everything you could hope for. The bathrooms are amazing. The living rooms are cozy. The dining table is homey and inviting and the bed is beyond comfortable. The little things- plenty of storage space, good lighting, an easy outlet in which to plug in the iron near an easy place to set the iron up- add up to be a big coup for this establishment. I could go on and on about the amenities, but, as wonderful as they are, the hotel's true strength is in their service. Everyone was accommodating. When the shower invitation list exploded the week before the shower, they helped me find the space for everyone, at no additional cost to me. The honored my request for a first floor room with outside access, via the inviting patio. When I called at 10 a.m. and asked, "Is it possible for you to clean our room before 11?" The reply was, "I'd love to, but I personally can't. I will send housekeeping there right away." Everyone was happy and helpful and positive. They made eye contact and thought of small details. I am a picky customer. It takes the planets to align for me not to find one thing wrong. They worked hard to make me happy, and I was beyond happy at this hotel. If you want to be surrounded by wineries, this is not one of those hotels. The location is a bit funky, on the outskirts of a corporate park, but it is not far from highway 29, one of the gateways to the wineries, and it is a good jumping off point for several area attractions. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. I think the experience is best summed up by the mom-to-be at my shower. She said, no less than 10 times at the shower, "I want to live here." It feels as comfortable as home, but with daily housekeeping service.

Reviews.Title: “The service did not match the venue”
Reviews.Author: prettyshoesiowa
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel and our room was beautiful, there were many issues with this resort. I booked the room (a 2 bedroom suite) online and there was no indication that the second bedroom was actually a separate hotel room. I had intended on using the second bedroom for our infant daughter but could not since the room was separated by a hallway and two doors. Tracking down housekeeping was a daily chore. Everyday (except for the last day of our stay) I had to call the front desk multiple times to request housekeeping. The housekeeping staff did not answer the front desk calls and seemed to not be interested in cleaning upon request. Our suite had a washer/dryer which was wonderful but the dryer was malfunctioning, causing stinky air to blow into our suite and the clothes never did dry fully. Again, a call to the front desk was met with apathy and a vague promise of "We'll send someone to look at it." Not suprisingly, no one ever came. We ordered room service for dinner and the food was truly appalling. My $36 palm sized chunk of "filet mingon" was not edible and my husbands turkey sandwich was just about the same quality. Our room and the grounds were beautiful but the service did not match the price we paid or the surroundings. I did enjoy the Spa Terra- a beautiful space with excellent services- no complaints there. If we had been staying at an $89 a night hotel, the service would have been acceptable but for the $300 plus a night, the service was appalling. Skip this resort and stick with something more established like the Silverado.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Far From the Wineries...”
Reviews.Author: bongo1480
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel stay at the Vino Bello thinking that it was in the heart of Napa and the Napa Valley. The hotel was about a ten minute drive from downtown Napa and about a half hour drive from the heart of Napa Valley and its wineries. The hotel is part of the Meritage group and I was a little confused as to how it fit in with Vino Bello. I stayed in the 2nd building on the first floor. It was great having a washer and dryer, but the room I had didn't look like what I had seen on the website. It was a little smaller and lacked a full kitchen, which was fine, since we didn't use it at all, save the kitchen sink. I didn't take advantage of any of the spa services, the pool or the winery that is housed on-site. It was a little strange to think there is a vineyard there, because it's in the middle of a corporate drive setting. I did use the exercise room, which could use a more modern set of treadmills, but it was empty, so I can't complain too much. Overall it's a good option for its amenities, but I didn't pursue those options. There was some construction going on, but it didn't bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, not so great location”
Reviews.Author: Florida_Sunshine80
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is beautiful. We upgraded to the King Suite and although the person at the front desk had trouble doing his job and gave us the wrong directions to the building, the room made up to it. Upgrade is only 50 dollars more, but def worth it. It comes with jetted tub and fireplace. If booking here, make sure to keep in mind that this hotel is located outside of Napa. It’s a bit of a drive to downtown Napa and then about 30 miles to vineyards, which is not a big deal, but something to keep in mind after doing a full day of wine tasting. We headed back to San Francisco the following day, but other people that were staying here weren’t too happy about having to do the drive back to the vineyards the following day. Also if visiting Napa, make sure to visit Sterling Vineyards. It is $25 per person but you get to taste 3 different wines and most importanly ride in their cable car to the vinyard, which offers the most spectacular view of the region.

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Napa and Vino Bello made it memorable.”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripper69
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed the beauty and comfort of the resort. We have commented several times regarding your provision of a shuttle into town. We did not need to worry about too much wine tasting or getting lost in an unfamiliar area! The friendliness of the staff caused me to comment that this must be a great place to work. Thank you so much for a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...everything I wanted in a room”
Reviews.Author: LadyElle
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to leave! My dream room had a full kitchen, fireplace, lanai, supercomfy bed, soaking jetted tub and a good sized shower... WOW, the room at Vino Bello had it all. I was impressed since the room was squeaky clean and the complimentary bottle of wine, water and pepsi in the fridge was a very nice touch. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful. Early check-in wasn't a problem so sitting around waiting for a room wasn't necessary. The spa is located in caves. It was an interesting experience. I had the tension tamer and terra firma foot treatment. with David. Great way to refresh before hitting the wineries in the area. Although we didn't use it ~ room service it was available from early breakfast to late night snacks ~ pool was heated I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Vino Bello and plan to stay there next time I'm in the area. p.s. They also had a washer and dryer in the unit so I took advantage and washed everything before we headed out

Reviews.Title: “Just an average stay...”
Reviews.Author: MidwestGuest23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visit Napa each year for her birthday and spend 4 or 5 days hiking, relaxing, dining out at the many great restaurants and visiting a winery or two. We always stay a couple of nights at our favorite resort in the world, The Carneros Inn and save it for the last two nights of our trip. If you've never stayed at The Carneros Inn, and want the ultimate relaxation and top-rated guest experience and can afford the over $350 per night price tag, then please skip past the Vino Bello Resort and head over on Hwy. 121 to The Carneros Inn. You won't be disappointed. My wife can usually only afford two nights at The Carneros Inn and always spend a couple of nights testing out other resorts. For us, the experience at Vino Bello was just ok. Vino Bello gave us a room in their Chardonnay building which happens to be their Shell vacation ownership rooms. The toaster over was broken, their was a large stain on the carpet, most likely wine, and the toilet paper holder was broken. The couple next door to us on the 3rd floor had their TV on and we could hear every word of what they were watching. I had to turn our TV on to drown out the noise. Another worry is that the ice machine is located on the first floor outside of the secure entrance. It is in a back service corridor which is a bit odd place to put it for your guests to find. Also, we don't have kids, however I would feel uneasy sending my child to get ice when you have to go outside of the hotel building and the door lock behind you. Also there was cigarette butts at the base of the ice machine which tells possibly the employees are using this area as a smoking lounge. Be careful when asking the concierge in the main check-in building for a list of nearby restaurants, they don't have one, which is very odd, however they will start to recommend many in the Napa valley which they partner and use the list to sell you into joining them for a 90 minute presentation for selling their Shell Vacation Resort ownership to you. All in all, we will continue to search for other resorts and always get that wonderful feeling when we head down the road to The Carneros Inn for a couple of incredible days and nights of bliss. Please check out their website if you don't believe me. www.thecarnerosinn.com. By the way, this year they added two Audi A8 cars to their cottage resort and they use them to shuttle their guests around the property. The only reason I used their Audi A8 service was due to the extreme rain that was falling throughout our stay. Trust me, if you can afford the extra money then head down the road. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive”
Reviews.Author: RCMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights celebrating our anniversary. The room was gorgeous and the most spacious we have stayed in. We got a great deal, buy one night get the 2nd half off and so we booked the 1 bedroom suite. The staff was friendly and helpful. Never once were we approached about a time share. Although served 24 hours, the room service menu wasn't very appealing. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: swat23
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the one bedroom condo with my g/f for two night during the weekend of the Super Bowl. They have friendly staffs. The condo is super clean and the bathroom is huge. We enjoyed using the jetted tub inside the bdrm. Very cozy and relaxing. Not too far from the wineries. I would recommend this to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific rooms, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Redding75
Reviews.Content: Once you have made it through a somewhat unique approach to the resort (through an industrial park), you arrive at a very nice hotel with fantastic rooms. The one bedroom condo we stayed at was so roomy and comfortable, we had friends over one day for lunch that we cooked in the fully equipped kitchen and served at the huge dining room table seating 6 very comfortably. The living room has very comfortable couches where you can enjoy the fire place or the big flat-screen TV. The bedroom has a huge king size bed, with another good size flat-screen TV and a big tub directly adjacent to the bedroom between it and the bathroom. Everything is still in like new condition and very tastefully decorated. In terms of amenities, we didn't use too much, but there are two pools on the property, a business center with internet access, another great fire place in the lobby that is fun to hang out at, and on and on..... Overall, a great romantic getaway and yet can feel like home! We have been there twice and will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “slept in luxury”
Reviews.Author: mccannacraig
Reviews.Content: We visited family and the wineries in December and stayed at this location. It is not far from the wineries and the hotel can provide a wine tour map and some recommendations. I preferred staying here and away from the winery traffic so it was a very quiet setting. The service was excellent and the room was fully furnished with wine glasses and a complimentary bottle for tasting. It was nice to come back after a nice dinner and sit by the fireplace in the room to reflect on the day. The beds were very comfortable and other furniture went well with the decor. I would definetly stay here again. The staff was there to take care of any needs you may have.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: yordi
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Napa to spend some time together and got a pretty good deal at the Vino Bello. We liked the room, the view, and service overall was pretty nice. Upon arrival, they called to see if we found the room okay or if we needed anything else, I thought that was a nice touch. They had their own wine tasting in the afternoon and we liked the atmosphere and wine. We really liked our stay and would probably be back. True it isn't that close to the wineries but it made it easier for us when it was time to continue our journey. The only little problem that we had was the drain of the shower not working properly, but I guess it was partly my fault because I could've told them, I'm sure they'd have fixed it right away. Not that much of a problem since we only stayed for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Heartbreaking”
Reviews.Author: reno_gypsy
Reviews.Content: I convinced my husband and Mother-in-law to have a Christmas vacation out of town. I had to really fight to get my husband to agree on a stay at a "resort". The price was good for three people to stay, it was afterall a two bedroom "suite". When we arrived the location was kinda yucky, not really in Napa. We were checked in and went to our room and it was fabulous, everything they said it would be...except it was only one bedroom. So we had to get another room. They said all the two bedroom suites were taken and convinced us that two adjoining rooms would be just as luxurious. (First of all we made that reservation like six weeks in advance AND called two weeks before to check on it. ) The room was ugly,(so ugly, fire that decorator) the furniture was terrible and uncomforable, and we got no compensation for the mess up. We were charged $15/day as a resort fee to replenish the sodas, coffee and water in our fridge, that never did happen. We had to call to get towels replaced, they took the dirty ones, but didn't think we needed more I guess. The food in the Siena was expensive and uninterresting. I guess my biggest complaint is that I went for luxury, at $274 + $15 wasteful resort fee for my room and feel like I stayed at a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a weekend with family.”
Reviews.Author: michaeljsz
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Vino Bello 3 times now and have not had a single complaint. The staff is very pleasant and the room service is actually great tasting and fast compared to most resorts. We always get a 1 bedroom condo and it's perfect for small familys with children. We have twin 2 yr old boys and they get so excited everytime we go, they love running around the large rooms. We have stayed in many of the nicer resorts in Napa and found this resort to have the nicest rooms, nicest staff, and best room service. The resort itself is at the souther most tip of Napa so if your going to wine taste for the weekend and want to stay in the middle of all the vineyards and close to downtown its not that close(10 min to downtown) , but in my opinion its nice to stay in a quiet out of the way place after going up valley all day taking in the sights. If you wanna nice place, great rooms, great food, great staff,great pool area for kids all for a great price this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the sneaky resort Fee”
Reviews.Author: Vineys
Reviews.Content: I booked thru Hotwire. I compared rates and star ratings in Napa and committed with my credit card, and was appointed the Vino Bello. It is away from town a bit - but that is fine. I think it is NOT a 4 star as advertised. It is new, so naturally it is clean and has some nice amenities. But a 4 star is a 4 star - and newness should not be a reason for an increase in the rating system. I am a little hard of hearing, but boy can you hear every footstep of the people avove you! Get a top floor room!. The thing that made me the maddest, since I booked on Hotwire & was given a price before I committed, was the sneaky $30. "resort Fee" they charged me for my 2 night stay. They came up with a fancy name for it, but they might as well call it a "We- want -an -extra -$15 -per -night- fee" ... that was a bit sneaky...It's not that the place wasn't worth it & it's not about the money, rather the way they whip that on you as you check in...Say whaaa? Huh?....I did'nt make a fuss but I was certainly thinking that was a low blow. I sent a complaint in to Hotwire - they need to insist their offerings do not tack on extra costs "after the fact"...otherwise it defeats the purpose of shopping and comparing rates. ....In all fairness, the rooms though small, were well appointed, but it is still just another nice motel room....I think the main building (Meritage) with the fancy lobby and restaurant could be considered 4 star, but if you end up in one of the so-called condos Like the Cabernet building which is seperate - it is basically just another nice hotel room. 3 star to be sure, but 4 star would be a stretch....

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: krafter00
Reviews.Content: We loved our time at Vino Bello Resort. We were a little worried since it was a new resort and the prices were so reasonable, but were blown away by the accomodations. We stayed in a one room suite with a jacuzzi tub and fireplace. We used both of those every night, and slept very well in the comfortable bed. We were also concerned about the construction, but had no problem sleeping in until 9 each day. The only drawback is that it is on the south end of Napa, but the drive to the wineries was so pretty that we didn't mind. Be careful with the directions on the website, the turn on to "Corporate Way" is a mistake. The street is called something different from the direction we travelled from (Oakland Airport). We would recommend the hotel to anyone (and in fact, already have).

Reviews.Title: “NO RUNNING WATER”
Reviews.Author: Travelingfool20
Reviews.Content: We booked through plriceline and got a pretty good deal of $85/night considering it is low season in Napa. Upon arrival, i notcied the hotel is in the bottom of Napa, not the best location for wine tasting. While checking in, they failed to mention that there was NO WATER. The room was nice, kitchenette, W/D, I dont know if i Would rate it 4 star. But it was nice. As soon as we realized there was no water, we called the front desk, who said it was due to construction, would be turned on in 20 minutes. This happpened about 4 times. I asked to speak with a manager, they assured me one would call, they never did. 6 hours and a case of food posioning (not from there) later, Still no flushing toliet. It took quite a fit and us mentioning the fact this is completely unsanitary and unsafe( no water for sprinklers in case of a fire), to get us moved into another area of the hotel, which was not nearly as nice. The management and staff did absolutely nothing to compensate or even offer to refund the cost of the room. I called priceline, who I have been arguing with for 4 days, to get some sort of refund. The place isn't bad, but no concept of customer service when things get bad. Very disappointingl

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but.....”
Reviews.Author: jillyaz
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Vino Bello following Mapquest Directions with no problems. We were staying at Vino Bello as part of an offer from Shell Vacation Club. Check in was a breeze and we made our way to the room. It was a one bedroom with two (double or queen) beds, we preferred a king. We called the front desk and they said they had one King room available and would send someone over to give us a new key. That took over a half hour of us sitting in the room / standing in the hallway not wanting to mess up a room that we were not going to be staying in. The King room was wonderful - I guess you'd call it a mini-suite. It had beautiful decor and a kitchenette. My only complaint about the room was that the kitchenette took the whole wall in front of the bed and the TV was off to the right. There was no dresser for clothes only some small drawers in the kitchen area. Our kitchen sink was broken, the faucet was just laying there. We didn't need to use it or we would have called. We were only staying 2 nights. Every day we had 2 complimentary bottles of water and two sodas plus a bottle of wine on the first day. That was a very nice touch. The grounds at the resort were manicured and well taken care of. The hotel lobby and dining areas were very pretty. We did not eat at the hotel. For those interested and who happen to be on the same plan with Shell Vacation Club, the presentation was smooth. It was scheduled to be 90 minutes and it was not one minute over that. We received our free gift and were on our way. Check out was also no problem. My only issue with this resort is not a complaint about the resort. My husband and I were just not in love with Napa itself. My husband and I are both near 40 and we just were bored with the Napa scene after a few winery tours. We would just stay in Frisco next time and visit Napa for our couple winery tours.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing.....did not want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: pmr3150
Reviews.Content: Besides not getting the floor i had requested(I had read a few TripAdvisor reviews and had learned to request a top floor ,due to noise heard from guests above), everything was great. There were a couple times where the guests above were noisy(when moving around) . The rooms were great, they had all the things we needed from robes(not as nice as the Meritage robes) to glasses, dinnerware and even a washer and dryer. The room had a mini fridge that included a bottle of Trinitas Rose(a bit too sweet for my taste),water and soda.The decor of the room was nice and not to busy. The bed was ever so cozy, it was hard to get out of it. Overall It was a beautiful and relaxing resort and i did not want to leave. P.S. the jacuzzi Rocked!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected - avoid the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: large_red
Reviews.Content: From the description, I pictured a small to med. sized hotel tucked away in Napa. The Vino Bello is a building which is part of a complex in a corporate campus setting. It took ~30 minutes to check in. The service in the restaurant was awful and the food was forgettable. The rooms were very nice but you are not in a hotel building. You must walk two buildings over to get to the hotel. Not well explained.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous views”
Reviews.Author: OttawaDebbie
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the suite style of living at Vino Bello! The views from the room and patio were fabulous and the decor was luxurious. The kitchen was outstanding with the granite counters and great bathrooms! Being with another couple and sharing time in the living/kitchen area makes for very different holiday - especially in the morning over a cup of coffee and reading the daily paper.The bed was heavenly! The spa was one of the best I had been to and the hotel staff were fabulous and friendly. The wine was surprisingly good too - given it resides on the property! I would highly recommend this resort - and the location is good for exploring both valleys. A few misses - mostly small. No stereo in the rooms or suite. Parking was limited. The two bedroom suite should have doors that open to the common area - using a key all the time is annoying.
